questions.name: Which part of a method declaration specifies the data type of the returned value?
A parameter is a variable in a method declaration, while an argument is the actual value passed when the method is called.
Which of the following method declarations is valid in Java?
items: public int compute double x, double y {}
Because num is declared as static
Because the compiler optimizes the call

questions.name: Method overloading can be done by changing only the return type of methods.

Arrange the following steps in the correct order to declare and use a value-returning method:
1. Write the method heading with return type and parameters
2. Implement the method body with statements and return value
3. Call the method by its name with actual parameters
4. Store or use the returned value in the calling program

1.solution: Write the method heading with return type and parameters

2.solution: Implement the method body with statements and return value

3.solution: Call the method by its name with actual parameters

4.solution: Store or use the returned value in the calling program

questions.name: A static method belongs to the ____ rather than the object of a class.
Static methods cannot directly access instance variables.
Which of the following is the correct way to call a static method displayNumber() of class NumberClass?

items: Because each object has its own copy of num
Because num is static and shared by all objects
Because num was declared as final
Because the last object always overrides values

questions.name: Static methods can access instance variables directly.
Match the following Java keywords with their description:

1.right: method or variable belongs to the class

2.right: value cannot be changed or method cannot be overridden

questions.name: A constructor has the same name as the ____.
Constructors in Java can be inherited by subclasses.
Which of the following statements correctly creates an object using a constructor?
When a constructor calls another constructor within the same class, this is called ____.
Overloading constructors requires changing the parameter list, not just the return type.

Arrange the steps in creating a constructor with parameters:
1. Declare the constructor with the class name
2. Add parameters inside parentheses
3. Initialize instance variables using this keyword
4. Use the constructor in object creation with new

1.solution: Declare the constructor with the class name

3.solution: Initialize instance variables using this keyword

4.solution: Use the constructor in object creation with new

questions.name: Which keyword is used to declare an instance variable hidden from other classes?
Encapsulation allows restricting access only to declared public features.
Which of the following methods is an example of an accessor (getter)?
Match the encapsulation terms with their descriptions:

1.right: returns data from a private variable

2.right: changes data in a private variable

questions.name: An immutable class should provide setters to modify its fields.

Arrange the rules of implementing encapsulation:
1. Declare instance variables as private
2. Create getter methods with 'get' or 'is'
3. Create setter methods with 'set'
All classes in Java inherit from the ____ class.
A class can extend more than one parent class in Java.
Which of the following correctly declares a subclass Student that inherits from Person?
Match the inheritance terms with their definitions:
The super() call must always be the first statement in a constructor.

Arrange the constructor execution order in inheritance:
1. Call to parent constructor
2. Call to child constructor
3. Object fully created
Which keyword is used to define an interface in Java?
Interfaces can contain constants, abstract methods, default methods, and static methods.
Which of the following correctly implements an interface Drinkable?
Match the interface rules with their descriptions:

3.right: an interface can extend another interface

questions.name: A class cannot extend an interface in Java.

Arrange the steps for implementing an interface:
1. Use the 'implements' keyword in the class declaration
2. Provide implementations for all abstract methods
3. Create an object of the class

1.solution: Use the 'implements' keyword in the class declaration

2.solution: Provide implementations for all abstract methods

3.solution: Create an object of the class
